result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew John Philippi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Not to consume any alcohol.  Not to enter an establishment that sells alcohol for consumption on premises.  Not to possess any controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed Doctor.  Cannot possess a firearm.  Can not vote until civil rights are restored.
comply with probation and parole recommendations.  Submit a DNA sample. To take medication as prescribed.  To read victim's letter once a week.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew J. Philippi in court with attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Defendant Matthew J. Philippi in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:47 am Court recites cases 14 CF 72, 80, 114 and 14 CT 47 & app; counsel rec'd copy of PSI; Atty M recites discrepancies in PSI; court so notes; Victim addresses the court & recites statement; DA - statements, 3 yr prob, 110 days on OWI 3, 90 days in jail for battery chg, total of 200 days, 53 days credit, 147 days left to serve in jail, adopt PSI on CF cases; Atty M - 110 days OWI 3 concurs, obj to add'l time to misd. battery, adopt PSI, ?'s 53 days credit; Deft - statements; Court: 3 factors recited, 
14 CT 47: $3, 214 forf., 60 DTP, DL rev 30 mo., OADA, Victim Impact Panel, install IID, 
14 CF 72: 120 days jail misd. battery, concurrent with 14 CT 47, credit 53 days  - 120 days straight time; stat costs;
14 CF 80 & 114: w/h sent. 3 yr prob ea file, submit DNA testing, restitution, court costs, comply with P&P recommendations, no alcohol, no bars, no poss of controlled subst unless prescribed, take meds as prescribed.   Victim's letter - ordered to read 1x/week; cannot possess firearm, cannot vote until civil rgts restored; submit DNA sample ea. count and DNA surcharge as to ea. count.   Consecutive to other two files.  
Adj'd 12:27 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew John Philippi
Current: 1105 Kellogg Ave Trlr B22, Janesville, WI 53546 United States  (Effective: 12-29-2014)
Prior: 201 Spruce St, Spooner, WI 54801
Sentencing hearing on February 3, 2015 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Matthew J. Philippi in court with attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Defendant Matthew J. Philippi in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and  appearances. Also has 14CF114, 14CT47, 14CF80.   Court speaks to Mr. Philippi regarding his plea questionaire and waiver of rights.  Court finds that the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights. 
Court finds that there is a factual basis in 14CT47---Court finds that there is a factual basis in 14CF72---Court finds that there is a factual basis in 14CF80 and 14CF114.    State stipulates to the criminal complaints in the cases. 




14 CF 72--Count 1- Court finds him guilty and orders a JOC
Count 2 Dismissed but read-in


14 CF 114-Count 1-Def. pleads guilty, court finds him guilty and orders a JOC


14 CT 47---Count 1-Def. pleads guilty, court finds him guilty and Orders a JOC


14 CF 80-- Count 1-Def. pleads guilty, court finds him guilty and orders a JOC

Any and other all counts are dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the DOC to do a PSI--agent need not appear. 

Remains in the custody of the sheriff.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on December 15, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Matthew John Philippi appeared with Attorney Kate Murtaugh.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.
11:43 am Court recites case & appearances; Officer Hartl sworn & testifies, identified deft, court so finds, cont'd testimony; Atty M - nothing, witness excused; Court finds probable cause, bound over for trial; DA tenders Information; Court recites cts on Information; Atty M - waives reading, not guilty; Court enters NG, Oct. 31 subst., def. motions Nov. 28.   11:47 off record for scheduling.
11:48 am on record - Dec. 15 at 1 pm for all cases, bond cont.   Adj'd 11:50 am.
  Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 13, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant, Matthew John Philippi appeared with Attorney Kate Murtaugh .  Attorney  appeared for the State.  Atty Murtaugh waived reading.  Also has 14 CF 72, 14 CF 80 and 14 CT 47.  Time limits for prelim are waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on September 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant, Matthew J. Philippi appeared with Attorney Kate Murtaugh.  Attorney Winton appeared for the State.  Also has 14 CF 80 and 14 CT 47.  Information tendered to the Court.  Atty Murtaugh waived reading entered plea of not guilty.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 9, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Defendant, Matthew J. Philippi appeared with Attorney Kate Murtaugh.  Attorney Angeline E. Winton appeared for the State.  Also has 14 CF 80 and 14 CT 47.  Trevor Peterson called - sworn by Deputy clerk - examined Atty Winton.  Cross-examined Atty Murtaugh.  State re-direct.  State makes arguement.  Atty Murtaugh makes arguement.  State makes rebuttal.

COURT:  finds probable cause as to a misd. bound over on a misd. - info to be amended

14 CF 80 - Prelim - Officer Daniel Botty called - sworn by deputy clerk - examined Atty Winton.  Requests the Court take judicial notice of bail bond in 14 CF 72.  
  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

Atty Murtaugh waived reading and entered plea of not guilty as to 14 CF 80.  State has not filed info on 14 CF 72 to revisit charges.  Arraignment scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 26, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on August 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.
